perturbation.original_text: Buyer Affiliates shall pay ExxonMobil's Selling Affiliates invoice(s) not later than the days set forth in Attachment E hereto. All invoices shall be paid in full by wire transfer in accordance with the invoice's instructions.
perturbation.changed_text: Buyer Affiliates shall pay ExxonMobil's Selling Affiliates invoice(s) not later than the days set forth in Attachment E hereto. All invoices shall be paid in full by wire transfer in accordance with the invoice's instructions. However, Buyer may elect to defer 20% of any invoiced amount for a period of 90 days, subject to a late payment penalty of 1% per month.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by allowing the Buyer to defer a portion of the payment with a late payment penalty while the original clause mandates payment in full as per Attachment E. This creates uncertainty regarding the actual payment terms.

perturbation.original_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
Buyer/Buyer Affiliates shall pay for Product by Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) through the Automated Clearing House (ACH) using the
Corporate Trade Exchange (CTX) format, according to the payment terms described in Attachment E.
perturbation.changed_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
Buyer/Buyer Affiliates shall pay for Product by Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) through the Automated Clearing House (ACH) using the
Corporate Trade Exchange (CTX) format, according to the payment terms described in Attachment E. Notwithstanding the payment terms in Attachment E, Buyer may, at its sole discretion, elect to pay via company check, subject to a processing fee of $500 per check. In such case, the payment deadline is extended to 45 days after the invoice date.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by allowing payment via company check with an added fee and a different payment deadline. The original clause mandates EFT payments as described in Attachment E only, resulting in a conflict.

perturbation.original_text:
CHANGE IN CIRCUMSTANCES
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in Attachments A, G or H, in connection with any Change in Circumstances (as defined below), and
without limiting Seller's/ExxonMobil Selling Affiliate's other rights under this Agreement or applicable law, Seller/ExxonMobil Selling Affiliates shall
have the right: (i) only if required to enable Seller/ExxonMobil Selling Affiliate to comply with applicable laws and regulations, to terminate this
Agreement and accelerate all amounts due from Buyer hereunder, making them immediately payable (ii) to modify the payment terms hereunder;
and/or (iii) to require that Buyer/Buyer Affiliates pay in advance for shipments hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text:
CHANGE IN CIRCUMSTANCES
Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in Attachments A, G or H, in connection with any Change in Circumstances (as defined below), and
without limiting Seller's/ExxonMobil Selling Affiliate's other rights under this Agreement or applicable law, Seller/ExxonMobil Selling Affiliates shall
have the right: (i) only if required to enable Seller/ExxonMobil Selling Affiliate to comply with applicable laws and regulations, to terminate this
Agreement and accelerate all amounts due from Buyer hereunder, making them immediately payable (ii) to modify the payment terms hereunder;
and/or (iii) to require that Buyer/Buyer Affiliates pay in advance for shipments hereunder. However, the Seller shall maintain existing payment terms for a period of one year from notification to the buyer of the change in circumstances.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that the Seller can modify payment terms under Change in Circumstances, but then mandates maintaining existing payment terms for one year, even after notification. This creates ambiguity regarding when and how payment terms can be adjusted after a Change in Circumstance.
